MANUAL: apt-calvin-equivalent (1.16.1)

apt-calvin-equivalent will check to see if two Calvin files contain equivalent values.

This can be annoying to do with a regular diff as differences in precision and compiler rounding errors can lead to representational differences for two numbers that are equivalent (i.e. 1.0 == 0.99999981).

Quick Start

To compare Calvin binary files file1.cychp and file2.cychp, use:

apt-calvin-equivalent -i setIgnore.tsv -e 0.001 -f 0.0002 -c 0.9999 file1.cychp file2.cychp

Options:

apt-calvin-equivalent - check to see if two Calvin files contain equivalent values.

This can be annoying to do with a regular diff as differences in 
precision and compiler rounding errors can lead to representational 
differences for two numbers that are the same (i.e. 1.0 == 0.99999981).

usage:
   apt-calvin-equivalent -epsilon 0.001 -fraction 0.0001 -c 0.9999 file1.cychp file2.cychp

options:
   -h, --help                           This message. [default 'false'] 
   -k, --check-header Check header parameters and values match.
                          [default 'true'] 
   -i, --ignore-params-file Path to TSV file with list of header
                          parameters, datasets, and
                           dataset columns to ignore. (One column 
                          with header line IgnoreParameters) [default
                          ''] 
   -m, --epsilon-map-file Path to TSV file with mapEpsilon parameter
                          threshold values.
                           (Two columns with header line MapParameter
                          MapEpsilon) [default ''] 
   -l, --message-limit Maximum number messages to report. [default
                          '1000'] 
   -e, --epsilon Epsilon tolerance to differences. [default
                          '.001'] 
   -f, --fraction Fractional tolerance to differences.
                          [default '0.0'] 
   -c, --correlation Correlation tolerance to differences.
                          [default '1.0'] 
   -v, --version Display version information. [default
                          'false'] 
   -n, --report-nan-num-diff Report differences between NaN and non-NaN
                          values. [default 'false']
